definition: to pat/to clap/to slap/to swat/to take (a photo)/to shoot (a film)/racket (sports)/beat (music)
according to/in accordance with/to shine/to illuminate/to reflect/to look at (one's reflection)/to take (a photo)/photo/as requested/as before

sentences.english: I went to the West Lake to see them yesterday, there already many people gathered and took pictures of them.
sentences.chinese: 昨天我去西湖邊看它們，那兒已經有很多人在拍照了。

sentences.english: Those taking part were volunteers who were offered a limited edition copy of the photo.
sentences.chinese: 參與拍照的志願者可獲贈一份限量版照片。

sentences.english: Had a Cowlick In Its Hair…And Didn't Pull a Face When Photographed.
sentences.chinese: 發一團糟，拍照的時候也沒有做鬼臉。

sentences.english: Can you recommend some good places to take pictures in San Francisco?
sentences.chinese: 你能推薦幾個舊金山適合拍照的地方嗎？

sentences.english: He and his son wander through the Old City of Jerusalem, snapping photos as they go.
sentences.chinese: 他和兒子在耶路撒冷老城中漫步，一邊走一邊拍照。

sentences.english: Me encanta fotografiarme con mis amigos .
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡和我的朋友們拍照。

sentences.english: A camera doesn't take the photo, nor does any piece of photographic equipment.
sentences.chinese: 相機自己可不會拍照片，任何一件攝影器材都不會。

sentences.english: I've been taking pictures since I was 12, and I've always been fascinated by biology.
sentences.chinese: 我12歲就開始拍照片，而且我一直對生物學着迷。

sentences.english: Here is the "making of" taken in Athens and Santorini.
sentences.chinese: 這是於雅典及聖托里尼拍照時的花絮。

sentences.english: Who takes photographs of their own home?
sentences.chinese: 誰會給自己的家拍照呢？

sentences.english: When taking photographs of treasured possessions, include references in the photographs.
sentences.chinese: 在爲珍貴物品拍照時，畫面裏須含有參照物。

sentences.english: They have satellites in space that can take pictures of your license plate.
sentences.chinese: 太空站裏的衛星甚至可以拍到你的汽車拍照。

sentences.english: Fedor says she also tends to tilt her head a bit to the right in photos.
sentences.chinese: 費鐸也說，她也在拍照時將頭略微昂起。

sentences.english: Wei Bin took photos of us standing in front of the Buddha.
sentences.chinese: 魏斌拍照我們站在前面的佛。

sentences.english: Today, telescopes take pictures using forms of light hidden from the eye.
sentences.chinese: 如今，望遠鏡是用不可見光拍照的。

sentences.english: They take pictures almost daily and all are cut in weird shapes.
sentences.chinese: 他們幾乎每天都要拍照，並且都喜歡裁成怪異的形狀。

definition: to take a picture or video of oneself/to take a selfie/selfie
camera (abbr. for 照相機|照相机[zhao4 xiang4 ji1])/at the opportune moment/as the circumstances allow
camera self-timer mode (for delayed shutter release)
selfie stick/also written 自拍杆[zi4 pai1 gan1]
to pat/to clap/to slap/to swat/to take (a photo)/to shoot (a film)/racket (sports)/beat (music)
